Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Psacotheasin (knottin-type peptide, UCSS1a; 3S=S, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: active against tested Gram+ bacteria E. faecium ATCC 29212 (MIC 25 uM), P. acnes ATCC 6919 (MIC 12.5 uM), and S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 25 uM) as well as Gram- bacteria E. coli O-157 ATCC 43895 (MIC 12.5 uM) and P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 25 uM).  Also active against C. albicans.MOA:bacteria:  The peptide is membrane active and also induce reactive oxygen species that triggers cell apoptosis (Hwang B et al 2011 Biochem Biophys Res Commun in press).Updated Jan 2011.Updated 2/2025
Literature Information.Author: Hwang JS, Lee J, Hwang B, Nam SH, Yun EY, Kim SR, Lee DG.2010
Literature Information.Title: Isolation and Characterization of Psacotheasin, a Novel Knottin-Type Antimicrobial Peptide, from Psacothea hilaris
